translated: I lived in the wilderness then.ğŸ”½Content with gain and no gain,
with roots and fruits;
Seeking a teacher,
I lived alone.
The Fully Enlightened One named Sumedha,
appeared in the world then;
He revealed the Four Noble Truths,
rescuing the great people.
I did not hear of the Fully Enlightened One,
nor did anyone tell me;
After eight years had passed,
I heard of the Leader of the World.
Taking out firewood,
and sweeping the hermitage;
Taking a load of firewood,
I left the wilderness.
Staying one night,
in villages and towns;
Gradually I approached Candavati,
then I approached.
The Fortunate One at that time,
Sumedha, the Leader of the World;
Rescuing many beings,
taught the deathless state.
Surpassing the crowd of people,
Having worshipped the ocean of Victors;
Placing my outer cloak over one shoulder,
I consoled the Leader of the World.
